Straight Shot listens as Airhammer chimes in, and then looks to him while s=
till on his back.  It made her think of Rodimus and what could possibly be =
happening to him.  A gloomy expression is cast upon her face.

" Dinobot ch=
ose ta go back to being a Predacon.  It's so much easier being a bad guy th=
ese days than it is ta be a Maximal.  It's an easy way out.  That's why Rod=
imus gave into that dark side of himself, it's an easy way out of dealing w=
ith his own personal demons.  Maybe there isn't anything we can do ta snap =
him out of that, because it was his choice ta turn on us.   Maybe all this =
time he really never wanted anything ta do with the responsibility of the M=
atrix, and let himself get corrupted, just like Dinobot did.  Oh sure, the =
upgrades are impressive but they never stand up for what really matters.  A=
nd I feel sorry for you guys because what you have will never outshine the =
most important power of all.  One so simple and one that we all share, and =
one that can only be found deep within all of our sparks.  Tucson said it b=
est, " You don't need fancy upgrades to be powerful, all you need is right =
there, inside you.  Just look deep into your spark and you'll find it."

Sh=
e smiles as she puts a gentile paw on Airhammer's chest.

" Nothing will ev=
er defeat what's in here, nothing.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cy=

> >
> > Rattrap glares at Din=
obot.
> >
> > " Okay, so bad stuff happened a long time ago!  I admit I mes=
sed up!  But
> > for the sake of Primus, can we put this behind us and just=
 move on!?
> > Tucson's out there with Optimus Primal, Cheetor, Rodimus and=
 now Nightlight!
> >  Every astrosecond we waste here is one less we have t=
a find them and get
> > 'em back safely!  And you got Cyclonus'n Scourge ta=
 worry about too!  So
> > let's try and work together here and actually acc=
omplish something!"
> >
> > Straight Shot nods.
> >
> > " Look, Dinobot, he=
's right, our comrades need us more than ever and we
> > really can't affor=
d ta let them down.  Magmatron is out there and unless we
> > put our diffe=
rences aside, like Tucson was attempting to achieve with all of
> > us, we =
might as well hand the planet over to that monster and head for the
> > hil=
ls.  None of us want that, we work too hard to defend what little
> > terri=
tory we have.  Let's keep it that way. "
> >
> > She stands up on Quickstri=
de's rump, on her hind legs.
> >
> > " Tucson started this because he belie=
ves that unity is our best weapon
> > against a formidable foe such as Magm=
atron.  If we fought separately, none
> > of us would survive his onslaught=
.  He did this for ALL of us.  He didn't
> > have to but he did, and it wou=
ld be a real slap in the face for him if we
> > let it fall apart now.  Ple=
ase, we gotta try ta work together, because if we
> > don't, we could end u=
p being the losers."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> There is a watchful smile from AIRHAMM=
ER as he watched the
> conversation go back and forth. He is not the long w=
inded sort, and so
> stays largely quiet in all of this.
> 
> "Ahh yes, you=
 were a Maximal at one time weren't you?" BANTOR said to
> the new and impr=
oved DINOBOT, "First Predacon, then Maximal and now
> Predacon again?" He s=
aid as he tilted his head in DINBOT's direction.
> "You seemed to have had =
an upgrade or two."
> 
> BANTOR gestured at DINOBOT's frame, "You look more=
 like the old
> Megatron now, before he went all draconish."
> 
> Meanwhile=
 on the otherside of the clearing SKYSHADOW was still looking
> at HYDRAS a=
waiting his next words and LEO was standing towards the
> middle of the cle=
aring, a growing sense of agitation.
> 
> WINGCALIBER, TORCA and SANTON wer=
e standing next to him, waiting on
> the small sidebar conference to end wh=
ile NOCTORRO was pacing around,
> obviously letting his own sense of impati=
ence get the better of him.
